name: Charles Saxon
biography:
Born 1920
B.A. Columbia.
Editor, Dell Publishing Co.
Bomber pilot, World War II.
1956-1988  Contract artist, The New Yorker.
Work appeared in Time, Newsweek, McCall's, Punch, Sports Illustrated, Fortune, others.
Publications: "One Man's Fancy", an anthology of New Yorker drawings (1977).
Died 1988.
Source: http://cartoon.org  (International Museum of Cartoon Art)
